definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: Julie acts like a love-sick puppy when she's around Mike.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉在邁克身邊時，就像是個得了相思病的小狗。

sentences.english: I was glad to find out Murry was only sick with love.
sentences.chinese: 我很高興地發現默裏只是得了相思病。

sentences.english: She has pined away since she got lovesickness.
sentences.chinese: 她自從得了相思病而益發憔悴。

sentences.english: As time went by, a lovesickness of fashionable clothes came into me.
sentences.chinese: 天長日久，我便害了一種迷戀時髦服裝的相思病。

sentences.english: Lovesickness is a condition brought upon us, against our will, by a force somehow external to us.
sentences.chinese: 相思病是被外力違揹我們的意志強加於身上的。

sentences.english: But, where do lovelorn young couples elope?
sentences.chinese: 但是，害了相思病的年輕情侶們都私奔何方呢？

sentences.english: The doctor said I is love-sick.
sentences.chinese: 醫生說我是得了相思病。

sentences.english: Freud called lovesickness “the psychosis of  normal people.”3
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德把相思病喚作“正常人的精神病。”

sentences.english: Summertime, my rhymes were so lovesick .
sentences.chinese: 夏天，我的節奏害了相思病。

sentences.english: The lovesick St. British Excel themselves each Valentine's Day.
sentences.chinese: 每年聖瓦倫丁節，患相思病的英國人都表現出色。

sentences.english: Freud called lovesickness “the psychosis of normal people.”3
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德把相思病喚作“正常人的精神病。”

sentences.english: The true lovesickness that there is scientific basis?
sentences.chinese: 真的有科學依據的相思病嗎？

sentences.english: In other words, do not let everyone see how lovesick you are.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，不要讓大家看到你害了相思病。

definition: no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
see 無可救藥|无可救药[wu2 ke3 jiu4 yao4]
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
same as 懷春|怀春[huai2 chun1]
to fall sick/to contract an illness
